nodes.name: Ollama Model

nodes.name: Sticky Note

parameters.content:
# ü¶ô Ollama Chat Workflow

A simple N8N workflow that integrates Ollama LLM for chat message processing and returns a structured JSON object.

## Overview
This workflow creates a chat interface that processes messages using the Llama 3.2 model through Ollama. When a chat message is received, it gets processed through a basic LLM chain and returns a response.

## Components
- **Trigger Node**
- **Processing Node**
- **Model Node**
- **JSON to Object Node**
- **Structured Response Node**
- **Error Response Node**

## Workflow Structure
1. The chat trigger node receives incoming messages
2. Messages are passed to the Basic LLM Chain
3. The Ollama Model processes the input using Llama 3.2
4. Responses are returned through the chain

## Prerequisites
- N8N installation
- Ollama setup with Llama 3.2 model
- Valid Ollama API credentials

## Configuration
1. Set up the Ollama API credentials in N8N
2. Ensure the Llama 3.2 model is available in your Ollama installation

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note1

## Model Node
- Name: Ollama Model
- Type: LangChain Ollama Integration
- Model: llama3.2:latest
- Purpose: Provides the language model capabilities

nodes.name: Sticky Note5

parameters.content:
## JSON to Object Node
- Type: Set Node
- Purpose: A node designed to transform and structure response data in a specific format before sending it through the workflow. It operates in manual mapping mode to allow precise control over the response format.

**Key Features**
- Manual field mapping capabilities
- Object transformation and restructuring
- Support for JSON data formatting
- Field-to-field value mapping
- Includes option to add additional input fields

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note6

parameters.content:
## Structured Response Node
- Type: Set Node
- Purpose: Controls how the workflow responds to users chat prompt.

**Response Mode**
- Manual Mapping: Allows custom formatting of response data
- Fields to Set: Specify which data fields to include in response

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Structured Response

assignments.name: text

nodes.notes: This set node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Error Response
nodes.notes: This set node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note7

parameters.content:
## Error Response Node
- Type: Set Node
- Purpose: Handles error cases when the Basic LLM Chain fails to process the chat message properly. It provides a fallback response mechanism to ensure the workflow remains robust.

**Key Features**
- Provides default error messaging
- Maintains consistent response structure
- Connects to the error output branch of the LLM Chain
- Ensures graceful failure handling

The Error Response node activates when the main processing chain encounters issues, ensuring users always receive feedback even when errors occur in the language model processing.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# üó®Ô∏èOllama Chat

## Overview
Automated workflow: üó®Ô∏èOllama Chat. This workflow integrates 5 different services: stickyNote, lmOllama, chainLlm, set, chatTrigger. It contains 14 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 14
- **Node Types**: 5
- **Error Handling**: ‚úÖ Implemented
- **Security**: ‚úÖ Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: ‚úÖ Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **When chat message received**: chatTrigger
- **Basic LLM Chain**: chainLlm
- **Ollama Model**: lmOllama
- **Sticky Note**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note1**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note2**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note3**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note4**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note5**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note6**: stickyNote
- ... and 4 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
